articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Former French Minister
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Former French Minister
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with former Minister of Cooperation of France Bernard Debre, member of the National Assembly from the People's Movement Union, and his companion who are on a visit to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: Sojourn of French Guests
articles.content:
Sojourn of French Guests
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Bernard Debre, member of the National Assembly and former minister of Cooperation of France, and his companion visited the DPRK from Nov. 2.
					 They visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid respectful homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The minister of Foreign Affairs and the minister of Public Health of the DPRK met the French guests and had a talk on the issues of realizing the contacts and exchanges in various fields including the public health and developing the cooperative relations.
					
					 The French guests visited the President's old home in Mangyongdae and several other places in Pyongyang and inspected educational, cultural and public health institutions and a co-op farm.
					
					 They donated the latest medical appliances and medicines to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from French Guest
articles.content:
Gift from French Guest
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting former minister of Cooperation of France.
					 The gift was handed over to an official concerned by Bernard Debre, member of the National Assembly from the People's Movement Union and former minister of Cooperation of France.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Meets Vietnamese Delegation
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with a delegation of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union of Vietnam led by Vo Van Thuong, first secretary of its Central Committee, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					 Present there were First Secretary Ri Yong Chol and other officials of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and Le Van Cu, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 On the occasion the head of the delegation hoped that the Korean people would register greater successes in building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation by dint of single-minded unity.
					
					 He expressed the resolution to strive for further development of the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Gift from Vietnamese Youth Union
articles.content:
Gift from Vietnamese Youth Union
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Central Committee of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union of Vietnam.
					 The gift was handed over to Choe Ryong Hae, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Vo Van Thuong, first secretary of the Central Committee of the union who is on a visit to the DPRK, on Friday.

articles.title: Reunion of Separated Families from North and South Closes
articles.content:
Reunion of Separated Families from North and South Closes
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south of Korea that began at Mt. Kumgang Resort in the DPRK came to a close.
					 Those from the north had family reunions with those from the south and exchanged long pent-up inmost thoughts on Thursday, too. 
					
					 They spent a pleasant time, taking meals and pictures together in family atmosphere. 
					
					 Those from the north bid farewell to their kin from the south on Friday.
					
					 Hardly repressing the regret at parting, they expressed their will to make positive efforts to bring earlier the day of national reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: Gift from Chinese School
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese School
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the "Kim Il Sung Class" of Beijing Middle School No. 5 in China on the occasion of the 60th birth anniversary of the class.
					 The gift was handed over Tuesday to Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, during his China visit to attend the celebrations of the anniversary.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of theInternational Institute of the Juche Idea who visited the DPRK, said that he deeply grasped the validity and vitality of the Songun politics, witnessing the Korean people dynamically advancing with confidence in the future.
					 Noting that President Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea and the Songun idea, Vishwanath said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who is identical to the President, is leading the Korean revolution to victory and glory.
					
					 The Korean people rallied around Kim Jong Il are pushing forward the production and construction, he said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. styling itself as the "only superpower" in the world dares not provoke the DPRK. This is because there is in the DPRK the Songun politics that calls for settling all theissues on the principle of attaching importance and priority to the military affairs.
					
					 It is thanks to the Songun politics that the DPRK, not a big country, is fully demonstratingits dignity and might as it is today.
					
					 The Songun politics serves as the most powerful treasured sword for the Korean people.
					
					 The Songun politics of the DPRK reliably guaranteeing the sovereignty of the country and the nation and the building of a rich and powerful country is, indeed, the most effective mode of revolutionary leadership and a peculiar political mode to be followed by those countries aspiring after independence.
					
					 The great feats of Kim Jong Il who is bringing about epoch-making changes with his ever-victorious Songun politics will shine long.

articles.title: DPRK Advances to Finals of AFC U-16 Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Advances to Finals of AFC U-16 Championship
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK boys football team trounced its Japanese rival 2:1 in semifinals held on Nov. 4 to gain the final berth in the 2010 Asian U-16 Soccer Championship.
					 The DPRK footballers fully demonstrated the technique they trained at ordinary times and the power of strong combination.
					
					 The DPRK team will meet its Uzbek rival in finals to be held on Nov. 7.

articles.title: National Korean Dress Exhibition Held
articles.content:
National Korean Dress Exhibition Held
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The 8th national Korean dress exhibition was held in Pyongyang from November 1 to 5.
					 On display at the Central Youth Hall, venue of exhibition, were more than 700 Korean dresses (jacket and long skirt) of various seasonable shapes presented by the garment production units under ministries and national institutions and in the field of public service across the country and members of the women's union.
					
					 The Garment Institute under the Ministry of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry, the Unha Guidance Bureau, the Pothonggang District Combined Tailor's Shop and a group of South Phyongan Province presented Korean dresses which add up to beautiful and refined curves and make up good harmony with bright and mellow color to suit the bodily figure, sentiment and feelings of the Korean women.
					
					 Lecture on technical issues arising in processing Korean dresses and colorful activities including technical service and fashion show were held in the period of the exhibition.
					
					 Its closing ceremony took place on Friday.

articles.title: Rim Jung Ryang, Commander of Anti-Japanese Volunteer Corps
articles.content:
Rim Jung Ryang, Commander of Anti-Japanese Volunteer Corps
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Recorded in the history of Korea were names of volunteer corps commanders who fought bravely against the Japanese aggressors during the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598).
					 Among them is Rim Jung Ryang who was active in the Pyongyang and Junghwa areas.
					
					 When the invaders reached the Junghwa area (now Junghwa County, North Hwanghae Province), he formed a volunteer corps with some 400 people and became its commander.
					
					 His corps assaulted the enemies plundering the Pyongyang and Junghwa areas and those traveling for communication with other areas.
					
					 The Japanese aggressors, menaced by activities of his volunteer corps, attacked the fortress where the corps was stationed in November 1592 by mobilizing huge forces.
					
					 But the volunteers, under the command of Rim, gave a heavy blow to the enemies in the battle.
					
					 Rim's feats in many battles to defend the country have long been told among the people.
					
					 Some buildings used by him and an epitaph of his services still remain intact in Sangam-ri, Kangnam County, North Hwanghae Province.

articles.title: Revitalization of Inter-Korean Dialogue Called for
articles.content:
Revitalization of Inter-Korean Dialogue Called for
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Nowadays dialogue for cooperation in the field of humanitarianism is taking place between the north and the south amid the great attention of people at home and abroad. To positively preserve the atmosphere of dialogue provided with much effort is very important for improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving peace and independent reunification of the country.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and overseas hope that the humanitarian work, to say nothing of the issue of separated families and relatives, would be revitalized to improve the deteriorated inter-Korean relations as early as possible, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 To revitalize the dialogue between the north and the south is the best way for improving their present abnormal relations.
					
					 Without putting an end to the present situation of mistrust and confrontation between the north and the south and turning their relationship into that of reconciliation and cooperation, is it impossible to ease the acute tension between the north and the south and achieve peaceful reunification.
					
					 An urgent task in improving the inter-Korean relations at present is to revitalize the dialogue between the north and the south.
					
					 This dialogue should be an occasion to solve in an open-hearted manner the issues arising between the north and the south. It should never be used as a lever to defend and justify any wrong assertion and policy.
					
					 Even now the south Korean authorities remain unchanged in their inveterate stance of confrontation with fellow countrymen, though outwardly calling for dialogue.
					
					 Rejection to dialogue just means seeking confrontation and war.
					
					 The north-south dialogue should be substantially conducive to independent reunification, peace and prosperity, and it should serve as one reflecting the will of all political parties, public organizations and people from all walks of life in the north and the south.
					
					 Nobody can expect improved inter-Korean relations anytime if the south Korean authorities frantically stage the joint military exercises with foreign forces to threaten the dialogue partner and persist in plot slandering its system as they are now doing.
					
					 The continuation of the present deteriorated north-south relations will bring nothing good to the south Korean authorities, either.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should squarely face up to the reality and drop their anachronistic anti-DPRK policy and turn to the respect and honest implementation of the inter-Korean declarations.
					
					 There is no change in the DPRK's stand to achieve the unity of the nation and resolve the reunification problem by developing the north-south dialogue.

articles.title: Displaying Might of Army-People Unity Called for
articles.content:
Displaying Might of Army-People Unity Called for
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The great army-people unity is an ever-victorious weapon of the DPRK holding the great illustrious commander of Songun in high esteem and an engine of bringing about leaping progress and innovation.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in an editorial. It goes on:
					
					 Today the DPRK is vigorously advancing with the might of the great unity between the army and the people.
					
					 They are working shoulder to shoulder in every important site of building a thriving nation in one mind and with one intention.
					
					 All the servicepersons and people are firmly rallied behind the headquarters of the revolution with the same ideology and will, the spirit of assisting the army and the people are being fully displayed and a high-pitched drive for effecting the great revolutionary surge is prevailing in the DPRK. It is the true picture of the era of Songun.
					
					The great unity between the army and the people serves as a powerful treasured sword and a foundation of the society of the DPRK which helps overcome all sorts of ordeals to emerge victorious as it was consolidated in the whole course of the protracted revolution and further strengthened in the tempest of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The might of the great unity between the army and the people is inexhaustible as all the servicepersons and people share the destiny with the same ideology and fighting spirit.
					
					They are now bringing about great innovation and leap forward in every site of effecting a great surge in order to translate into reality the plan and determination of General Secretary Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation.
					
					The Korean People's Army is creating a new Chollima speed in the era of Songun in the important fields for building a thriving nation and fully demonstrating its might as the pillar and the main force of the revolution and all the people are effecting a great upswing in the production and construction in the revolutionary solider spirit. It is the heroic stamina of Songun Korea.
					
					 The epoch-making changes and the great auspicious events in the DPRK under the banner of Songun are priceless fruitions of the devoted efforts exerted by the servicepersons who take the lead in making a breakthrough in the great revolutionary surge and the heroic struggle waged by all the people with the same spirit, disposition and mettle as displayed by the soldiers.
					
					 Korean-style socialism is impregnable as all the servicepersons and people are united around the headquarters of the revolution as firm as a rock and the DPRK is sure to build a thriving nation as it is advancing with the might of the unity.

articles.title: Development of National Education Guarantees Construction of New Society
articles.content:
Development of National Education Guarantees Construction of New Society
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Developing the national education at an early date is important for the peoples of developing countries to firmly defend the national dignity and the country's sovereignty and build a new prosperous society.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
					
					 Only when the education is intensified to bring up the people, masters of the society, to be independent and creative beings, is it possible to develop the society rapidly and achieve prosperity of the country and the nation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Without able national cadres it is not possible to ensure smooth state administration nor is it possible to sufficiently build the national economy and increase the defence capacity.
					
					 The best shortcut to solving this issue is to develop the education and meet the demand for national cadres on its own.
					
					 The issue of talents is directly related to the issues of existence of a nation and the destiny of a state. 
					
					 Developing the education is of a great significance in encouraging the people to foil the ideological and cultural poisoning of the imperialists and carve out their destiny independently and creatively by their own efforts.
					
					 It is important for developing countries to eliminate all the remnants of the colonial slave education of the imperialists and democratize the education in order to properly develop the education.
					
					 The abolition of illiteracy, the outcome of the harsh obscuration policy of the imperialists, is one of the urgent tasks facing the peoples of developing countries.
					
					 Strengthening the South-South cooperation in the field of education provides a firm guarantee for developing the national education of developing countries as soon as possible.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Forcible Drafting of Koreans Denounced
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Forcible Drafting of Koreans Denounced
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Investigating Damage Done by Japan through Forcible Mobilization during Resistance against It and Supporting Victims of Forcible Mobilization Abroad, Etc. in south Korea on Nov. 1 exposed the damage done to Koreans who were taken to Japan in the period of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea. 
					 The organization opened to the public a report of investigation which it conducted from 2006 up to the present time with the help of relevant data and testimonies made by survivors and through field investigation to disclose the truth about the damage done to the Koreans who were forcibly mobilized for the construction of a hydroelectric power station in Hokkaido, Japan, in the 1940s.
					
					 According to the report, the construction of the power station which was pushed forward as part of "state policy" of the Japanese imperialists was reminiscent of a living hell and more than 1 000 Koreans were forced to do slavery labor. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists hustled the Koreans into the most dangerous work and allowed them to go out of prison-like lodgings only at work time.
					
					 The Koreans were forced into grueling jobs for more than 13 hours a day and suffered a lot from such unsanitary living conditions as living in a room with more than 100 men. 
					
					 They were often beaten in the middle of work and anyone who was captured while fleeing was mercilessly executed in the eyes of his fellow Koreans. 
					
					 The organization declared that it would extend the scope of investigation into forcible drafting of Koreans in the area of Hokkaido.

articles.title: Irregularities of Lee Myung Bak's Family Exposed
articles.content:
Irregularities of Lee Myung Bak's Family Exposed
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Lawmakers from the Democratic Party of south Korea Monday exposed the irregularities and corruption of the wife of traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					 They disclosed the fact that Kim Yun Ok, wife of Lee, received a stupendous sum of reward from the president of the Daewoo Shipbuilding and Maritime Co., Ltd. last year.
					
					 The "Grand National Party", Chongwadae, the Ministry of Justice, etc. are now sheltering such corruption, talking about "baseless defamation", they charged.
					
					 They also pointed out that the prosecution authorities let Han Sang Ryul, ex-director of the Office of National Tax Administration, and other persons involved flee abroad in a bid to hush up the bigger scandal related to Kim while seeking to obliterate evidence.
					
					 This is a deliberate action aimed to quell the public opinion and criticism of the people, they contended.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- During a banquet celebrating the New Year Juche 63 (1974), President Kim Il Sung called a woman peasant by his side.
					 Grasping her hands, he appreciated her services in farming and asked her about her farm's per-hectare yield of rice and corn.   
					
					 He, satisfied with her answer, introduced her to other participants in the banquet.
					
					 He then invited all of the participants to drink a toast to her health. 
					
					 Given a wine cup, the woman could hardly repress her tears. 
					
					 Looking at her weeping with emotion, the President asked her to take a drink first.
					
					 Much touched by the President's proposal, all the participants drank a toast to her health.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y Cuba
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y Cuba
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 3 en La Habana las conversaciones entre la delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la de la Republica de Cuba.
					  En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion militar de la RPDC presidida por el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Ri Yong Ho, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, el embajador Kwon Sung Chol y el agregado militar de la embajada coreana en Cuba, y por la cubana, el viceministro y jefe del Estado Mayor General de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias, Alvaro Lopez Miera, y los funcionarios del MINFAR y del Estado Mayor General de las FAR.
					
					  Ambas partes informaron de la situacion de los respectivos paises, intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad entre los ejercitos y los pueblos de los dos paises y llegaron al consenso en los temas tratados.

articles.title: Finalizado encuentro de familiares separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Finalizado encuentro de familiares separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Termino el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados en el Norte y el Sur de Corea que fue iniciado en el monte Kumgang de Corea.
					　Los familiares y parientes separados de la parte Norte se reunieron y departieron tambien el dia 4 por unidad familiar con sus consanguineos de la parte Sur.
					
					　Ellos pasaron agradables ratos comiendo y fotografiandose juntos en un clima ameno y se despidieron el dia 5 lastimandose la separacion y manifestando la voluntad de esforzarse activamente por reunificar cuanto antes la patria bajo la bandera de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".

articles.title: Bernard Debre visita a Pyongyang
articles.content:
Bernard Debre visita a Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El diputado a la Asamblea Nacional oriundo de la Union de Movimiento Popular Bernard Debre, ex ministro de Cooperacion de Francia, y su comitiva realizan una visita a Pyongyang desde el dia 2.
					Durante su permanencia, ellos rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung en el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan.
					
					El canciller y el ministro de Salud Publica de Corea discutieron con los huespedes el problema de realizar el contacto e intercambio y desarrollar las relaciones de cooperacion en varias ramas como salud publica.
					
					Los visitantes estuvieron en la casa natal del Presidente en Mangyongdae y varios establecimientos de la capital, los organos de educacion, cultura, salud publica y una granja cooperativa.
					
					Los huespedes donaron a Corea los aparatos medicos ultramodernos y medicamentos.

articles.title: Equipo coreano avanza a la final
articles.content:
Equipo coreano avanza a la final
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El equipo coreano avanzo a la final del Campeonato Asiatico de Futbol sub-16 2010 al doblegar a Japon por 2 a 1 en la semifinal, que tuvo lugar el dia 4, haciendo uso de sus tecnicas y gran unidad adquiridas en los entrenamientos cotidianos.
					  El once coreano jugara el dia 7 en la final frente a Uzbekistan.
